hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, when BTC's 20-day Bollinger Band width contracts to the 25th percentile of its 90-day range, a subsequent daily close outside the bands will lead to a directional move of at least 1.5x the pre-breakout band width in the direction of the breakout over the next 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often feature range-bound price action and declining volatility. A compression to extreme lows indicates a buildup of potential energy. A close outside the bands signals a release of this energy, with the market likely to trend in the breakout direction as new information is priced in, rather than immediately snapping back.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day BB Width <= 25th percentile of its 90-day rolling window
BTC daily candle closes > Upper BB (for long) OR < Lower BB (for short)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price moves 1.5x the pre-breakout BB width from the breakout close
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price re-enters and closes inside the Bollinger Bands

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The average post-breakout move over 5 days is less than 1.0x the pre-breakout BB width, or the win rate for such signals is below 45%.
